AreaData.Name: Ruins of Drannor
AreaData.Credits: {30 up} Ceran Ruins of Myth Drannor

Room.Name: In the ruins of the south gate
Room.Description: You stand before a pile of rubble marking the entrance to what looked to once be a fabulous elven city. Remains of what was once great still linger even here in the rocks and creeping undergrowth. The shattered archway leading into the city bears the markings of elvish highlords of longpast. To the east and west you can make out rock strewn paths around the city battlements. South of here heads into the dark forests.

Room.Name: In the ruins of the southern wall
Room.Description: You are standing amidst the ruins of the great city. Large rocks have fallen carelessly along the pathway and their absence from the walls is plain from the large holes in it. A strong smell of decay is evident, and the wind that whistles softly down the rocks is chilling.

Room.Name: On the remains of the battlement walls
Room.Description: You are standing up on the rubbled remains of the city walls. The walls are broken and rubbled, and the walkway around them is dangerous. Cold wind blows over you and a dark shadow from the surrounding forest seems to cover everything. The walkway heads east or back down to the ruined path of the city's old walls.

Room.Name: On the remains of the battlement walls
Room.Description: You are standing up on the rubbled remains of the city walls. The walls are broken and rubbled, and the walkway around them is dangerous. Cold wind blows over you and a dark shadow from the surrounding forest seems to cover everything. The walkway heads east and west.

Room.Name: On the remains of the battlement walls
Room.Description: The battlements here have totally collapsed. To the south the magnificent stone walls have caved in to make an impassable pile of rubble seperating this northern end of the wall from the southern. You can only head back north.

Room.Name: On the remains of the battlement walls
Room.Description: The battlements here have totally collapsed. To the north the magnificent stone walls have caved in to make an impassable pile of rubble seperating this southern end of the wall from the northern. You can only head back south.

Room.Name: On the remains of the battlement walls

Room.Name: On the remains of the battlement walls

Cold wind blows over you and a dark shadow from the surrounding forest seems to cover everything. The walkway heads north or you can go down to the rubbled ruins of the city walls.

Room.Name: In the ruins of the southern courtyard
Room.Description: The courtyard here is shattered and ruined after the devestation of some ages past and long forgotten conflict. Rubble has fallen freely across the once beautiful marble courts, and the stone fountain is dry and crumbling. To the north lies the ruins of Myth Drannor. A large collapsed archway heads south out of the city and toward the surrounding forest.

Room.Name: In the corner of the stone ruins
Room.Description: You are within the rubbled remains of an ancient city. Plants and weeds have grown across everything, and much of the time it almost seems as if the forest is trying to bury the city into the past. The ground here is level and reasonably flat, indicating that it was probably a market or common area.

Room.Name: Swampy grounds amidst the ruins
Room.Description: You are within the rubbled remains of an ancient city. Plants and weeds have grown across everything, and much of the time it almost seems as if the forest is trying to bury the city into the past. There is a lot of wet, damp puddles of mud in the ground here, almost like a swamp was starting to form.

Room.Name: Under a broken archway
Room.Description: Above you is a majestic but shattered stone archway. Intricately carved signs have been cut into it, and fine gems still lie embedded on it's surface. If ever there was an indication of an abandoned city this is it, gems left here untouched by even common looters and scavangers that usually haunt ruins. To the east the ruins open out into a large open space filled with swampish weeds and wet muddy gorund. In the distant north you can make out the ruins of some towers.

Room.Name: Walking through the rubbled ruins
Room.Description: You are amidst the ruins of the ancient elven city. All around you the stones have been crushed and scattered, left to erode with time. The greatness that was once here is long since gone and only the fine delicate stonework gives any indication of what once was. The ruins wind north towards some towers, or south to what appears to be a large broken archway.`

Room.Name: Walking through the rubbled ruins
Room.Description: You are amidst the ruins of the ancient elven city. All around you the stones have been crushed and scattered, left to erode with time. The greatness that was once here is long since gone and only the fine delicate stonework gives any indication of what once was. The ruins wind west and north towards some towers.

Room.Name: Walking through the rubbled ruins
Room.Description: You are amidst the ruins of the ancient elven city. All around you the stones have been crushed and scattered, left to erode with time. The greatness that was once here is long since gone and only the fine delicate stonework gives any indication of what once was. The ruins wind north towards a junction.

Room.Name: Between the Towers of Passing
Room.Description: You are standing in a large open space that appears almost as if maintained and kept clear. The rubble and overgrown forest flora seems to have avoided this region, and the destruction is more subdued here. Three towers lead off from the square here: a green tinted one to the north, blue tinted to the east and a blood red one to the west. The rubbled ruins lead southwards away from here.

Room.Name: Before a tower of Blue tinged stone
Room.Description: You are standing at the entrance to a small but conspicuous tower. Unlike the rest of the ancient city this tower appears to be in almost perfect condition. The wind here seems stilled and unnaturally quiet, not even the sound of your own footsteps seems to reach your ears. A large stone door tinged with some strange blue colour blocks the way east into the tower.

Room.Name: Before a tower of Green tinged stone
Room.Description: You are standing at the entrance to a small but conspicuous tower. Unlike the rest of the ancient city this tower appears to be in almost perfect condition. The wind here seems stilled and unnaturally quiet, not even the sound of your own footsteps seems to reach your ears. A large door made from some green coloured stone is blocking the way north into the tower.

Room.Name: Before a tower of Red tinged stone
Room.Description: You are standing at the entrance to a small but conspicuous tower. Unlike the rest of the ancient city this tower appears to be in almost perfect condition. The wind here seems stilled and unnaturally quiet, not even the sound of your own footsteps seems to reach your ears. A large stone door tinged with some strange red colour blocks the way west into the tower.

Room.Name: On a swampy part of the ruins
Room.Description: The ruins here are overgrown with dark wet swamp growth. Thick wisps of foul marsh gas rise up and hang in the air, almost burying the ruins beneath them.

Room.Name: On a crumbling bridge over a black river
Room.Description: You stand on a wide but decayed stone bridge. Large portions of the span have collapsed into the stagnant black waters beneath it, leaving huge holes that threaten to swallow any who venture too close. To the south the ruins seem to have become swamped with water and covered in marsh-like flora. North of here there is a pile of rubbled ruins, most of which is impassable, but a small section can be seen cleared away to allow some exploration.

Room.Name: In the ruins of an ancient city
Room.Description: You are standing in the remains of a very old ruined city. The rubble here is blasted and crushed beyond the power of anything you have ever seen before. Around you thick bushes and trees have grown from between the cracks in the stone ground, although nowhere near as much as would be expected from the time that the city has been here.

Room.Description: You are standing in the remains of a very old ruined city. The rubble here is blasted and crushed beyond the power of anything you have ever seen before. Around you thick bushes and trees have grown from between the cracks in the stone ground, although nowhere near as much as would be expected from the time that the city has been here.

Room.Name: In the ruins of an ancient city
Room.Description: You are standing in the remains of a very old ruined city. The rubble here is blasted and crushed beyond the power of anything you have ever seen before. Around you thick bushes and trees have grown from between the cracks in the stone ground, although nowhere near as much as would be expected from the time that the city has been here.

Room.Description: You are standing in the remains of a very old ruined city. The rubble here is blasted and crushed beyond the power of anything you have ever seen before. Around you thick bushes and trees have grown from between the cracks in the stone ground, although nowhere near as much as would be expected from the time that the city has been here.

Room.Description: You are standing in the remains of a very old ruined city. The rubble here is blasted and crushed beyond the power of anything you have ever seen before. Room.Description: You are standing in the remains of a very old ruined city. The rubble here is blasted and crushed beyond the power of anything you have ever seen before. Room.Description: You are standing in the remains of a very old ruined city. The rubble here is blasted and crushed beyond the power of anything you have ever seen before. Around you thick bushes and trees have grown from between the cracks in the stone ground, although nowhere near as much as would be expected from the time that the city has been here.

Room.Name: In the ruins of an ancient city
Room.Description: You are standing in the remains of a very old ruined city. The rubble here is blasted and crushed beyond the power of anything you have ever seen before. Around you thick bushes and trees have grown from between the cracks in the stone ground, although nowhere near as much as would be expected from the time that the city has been here. To the north you can see a large building that appears to have been restored by someone.

Room.Name: In the ruins of an ancient city
Room.Description: You are standing in the remains of a very old ruined city. The rubble here is blasted and crushed beyond the power of anything you have ever seen before. Around you thick bushes and trees have grown from between the cracks in the stone ground, although nowhere near as much as would be expected from the time that the city has been here.

Room.Name: In the ruins of an ancient city
Room.Description: You are standing in the remains of a very old ruined city. The rubble here is blasted and crushed beyond the power of anything you have ever seen before. Around you thick bushes and trees have grown from between the cracks in the stone ground, although nowhere near as much as would be expected from the time that the city has been here.

Room.Name: In the ruins of an ancient city
Room.Description: You are standing in the remains of a very old ruined city. The rubble here is blasted and crushed beyond the power of anything you have ever seen before. Around you thick bushes and trees have grown from between the cracks in the stone ground, although nowhere near as much as would be expected from the time that the city has been here.

Room.Name: In the ruins of an ancient city
Room.Description: You are standing in the remains of a very old ruined city. The rubble here is blasted and crushed beyond the power of anything you have ever seen before. Around you thick bushes and trees have grown from between the cracks in the stone ground, although nowhere near as much as would be expected from the time that the city has been here.

Room.Name: Before a bloody signpost
Room.Description: Here in the middle of the marshy ruins there is a large wooden sign covered in dried blood and adorned with blackened and cracked skulls. The ruins to the north of this sign seem ominous and less disturbed than to the west, and you notice that almost all the tracks lead out from the north, rather than into it.

Room.Name: At a junction in the swampy ruins
Room.Description: The wet marshlands that have grown here in the ruined elven city are almost completely taking over the land. There is very little sign in this part of the city of what once was, and the way through is blocked by the dense swamp muck and deep holes of water. There is a wide, cleared path leading east, and a darker path heading west. To the south the swamps seem to recede a little.

Room.Name: Walking through the swamp drowned ruins
Room.Description: The ground here is like a normal swamp...wet, muddy and stinking. There is almost no signs of the ancient city that once held power in this region, and it's almost as if it never had been here. This swampy region is the most blatantly obliterated part of the entire elven city.

Room.Name: Walking through the swamp drowned ruins
Room.Description: The ground here is like a normal swamp...wet, muddy and stinking. There is almost no signs of the ancient city that once held power in this region, and it's almost as if it never had been here. This swampy region is the most blatantly obliterated part of the entire elven city. The path heads north and west, and to the east you can smell the faint smell of salty air.

Room.Name: Walking through the swamp drowned ruins
Room.Description: The ground here is like a normal swamp...wet, muddy and stinking. There is almost no signs of the ancient city that once held power in this region, and it's almost as if it never had been here. This swampy region is the most blatantly obliterated part of the entire elven city.

Room.Name: Walking through the swamp drowned ruins
Room.Description: The ground here is like a normal swamp...wet, muddy and stinking. There is almost no signs of the ancient city that once held power in this region, and it's almost as if it never had been here. This swampy region is the most blatantly obliterated part of the entire elven city. To the east you can make out what looks like a raised clearing of rock above the swampy waters.

Room.Name: The residence of an Ancient Green dragon
Room.Description: You stand upon a wide upraised part of the swamp. Large claw marks have been scratched into the rocky surface of the rock and the burning smell of chlorine fills the air.

Room.Name: In a quiet swampy part of the ruins
Room.Description: The ruins here are almost buried by the swamp that has grown over it. Unlike most of the ancient elven city this part seems to have been almost obliterated by the destruction, leaving barely the smallest signs of what once was. There is an unnerving stillness in this region.

Room.Name: In a quiet swampy part of the ruins
Room.Description: The ruins here are almost buried by the swamp that has grown over it. Unlike most of the ancient elven city this part seems to have been almost obliterated by the destruction, leaving barely the smallest signs of what once was. There is an unnerving stillness in this region.

Room.Name: In a quiet swampy part of the ruins
Room.Description: The ruins here are almost buried by the swamp that has grown over it. Unlike most of the ancient elven city this part seems to have been almost obliterated by the destruction, leaving barely the smallest signs of what once was. There is an unnerving stillness in this region.

Room.Name: In a quiet swampy part of the ruins
Room.Description: The ruins here are almost buried by the swamp that has grown over it. Unlike most of the ancient elven city this part seems to have been almost obliterated by the destruction, leaving barely the smallest signs of what once was. There is an unnerving stillness in this region. To the northeast you can see what looks like a black tower standing within the swampy ruins.

Room.Name: In a quiet swampy part of the ruins
Room.Description: The ruins here are almost buried by the swamp that has grown over it. Unlike most of the ancient elven city this part seems to have been almost obliterated by the destruction, leaving barely the smallest signs of what once was. There is an unnerving stillness in this region. To the east you can see what looks like a black tower standing within the swampy ruins.

Room.Name: Before the Black tinged tower in the swampy ruins
Room.Description: You find yourself at the end of the swamp paths and before a large tower black tinged stone. The surface of the strange building appears smooth and strong, and it looks new even though the swamp growth has covered almost halfway up it's height. There is a black door leading north into the tower.

Room.Name: In a black hallway
Room.Description: You are in a hallway surrounded by black stone and silence. Nothing seems to stir, not even the air from the marshes outside. Their is something cold and evil in the air here. The hallway heads east and west, and there is a black door in the south wall leading outside.

Room.Name: In a black hallway
Room.Description: You are in a hallway surrounded by black stone and silence. Nothing seems to stir, not even the air from the marshes outside. Their is something cold and evil in the air here. The hallway heads north and west.

Room.Name: In a black hallway
Room.Description: You are in a hallway surrounded by black stone and silence. Nothing seems to stir, not even the air from the marshes outside. Their is something cold and evil in the air here. The hallway heads north and south.

Room.Name: In a black hallway
Room.Description: You are in a hallway surrounded by black stone and silence. Nothing seems to stir, not even the air from the marshes outside. Their is something cold and evil in the air here. The hallway heads south and west.

Room.Name: Before a huge black door
Room.Description: You are in a hallway surrounded by black stone and silence. To the south you can almost feel a prescence of pure evil through a massive green door.

Exit.Flags: Door Closed Locked PickProof NoPass NoBash

Room.Name: In a black hallway
Room.Description: You are in a hallway surrounded by black stone and silence. Nothing seems to stir, not even the air from the marshes outside. Their is something cold and evil in the air here. The hallway heads south and east.

Room.Name: In a black hallway
Room.Description: You are in a hallway surrounded by black stone and silence. Nothing seems to stir, not even the air from the marshes outside. Their is something cold and evil in the air here. The hallway heads north and south.

Room.Name: In a black hallway
Room.Description: You are in a hallway surrounded by black stone and silence. Nothing seems to stir, not even the air from the marshes outside. Their is something cold and evil in the air here. The hallway heads north and east.

Room.Name: A cold dark room
Room.Description: You have entered a room of the coldest winter. The air from your breath freezes upon your lips and your body almost goes into shock from the cold. There is nothing but ice and darkness in here. A massive green door lies in the northern wall and a stairwell heads up into the cold night.

Exit.Flags: Door Closed Locked PickProof NoPass NoBash

Room.Name: In a chilling dark hallway
Room.Description: The hallway here is not only dark but freezing cold. Ice hangs from the roof and staligmites of frozen blood protrude from the floor. The hallway heads off south, or you can take a staircase leading down.

Room.Name: Before a door of frozen blood
Room.Description: You are standing in a freezing room where even the walls themselves seem to be shivering. To the south there is a door of what looks like frozen blood.

Exit.Flags: Door Closed Locked PickProof NoPass NoBash

Room.Name: In a pitch black room
Room.Description: It's totally dark in here, your own light can't even penetrate more than two feet into the night. The air freezes on your breath, and even more chilling is the sound of something horribly powerful breathing and sending tremors through the tower. There is a bloody frozen door in the north wall and a staircase leading up.

Exit.Flags: Door Closed Locked PickProof NoPass NoBash

Room.Name: In a patch black hallway
Room.Description: It's totally dark here and you only know it is a hallway by the shape of the walls around you. Somewhere nearby a deep rumbling sends tremors through the floor and a heart stopping breathing sound can be heard. There is a staircase leading down, or you can go north along the hallway.

Room.Name: Before a dark blue door
Room.Description: You are in a totally dark hallway and the only thing you can see is the faint glow of a blue door in the north wall. As you approach it a physical feeling of pure hate and malice seems to come washing through it at you.

Exit.Flags: Door Closed Locked PickProof NoPass NoBash

Room.Name: In a bare black room
Room.Description: This room is totally bare, like a monastic refuge. The atmosphere, however, is chilling and almost overpowering in it's hate and evil. You can hear what is unmistakably the breathing of some massive and powerful creature nearby. To the south is a huge dark blue door, and a staircase heads up.

Exit.Flags: Door Closed Locked PickProof NoPass NoBash

Room.Name: Before a massive door of blackened heartstone
Room.Description: You are standing in a room of pure black rock. A prescence of immense power can be physically felt from here, almost like it was existing beyond the normal sense of real. In the north wall there is a door of indestructable heartstone that has somehow been charred and blackend.

Room.Name: In the room of Binding Light
Room.Description: This room is totally different to those before it. In here there is light that seems almost blinding and the atmosphere is one of subdued violence. Somehow something of divine power has created a room to nullify the darkest powers that reside in this ruined city, but not powerful enough to destroy it. The only way out is through the blackened heartstone door in the south wall.

Room.Name: On a dock in a bloody harbour
Room.Description: You are on a collapsed and ruined dock made of rusted steel and decayed wood. To the south you can see one of the harbours of Myth Drannor, filled with a shallow blood red water that laps continuosly upon the ruined harbour. The salty smell of blood fills the air, and there is something powerful and disturbing about the way the region seems locked in time. It is as if the bloodshed of the elves were only yesterday and not centuries ago. There is a ruined boathouse to the north, or you can walk east across the docks. West of here lie the marshlands of the Drannor ruins.

Room.Name: On a dock in a bloody harbour
Room.Description: You are on a collapsed and ruined dock made of rusted steel and decayed wood. To the south you can see one of the harbours of Myth Drannor, filled with a shallow blood red water that laps continuosly upon the ruined harbour. The salty smell of blood fills the air, and there is something powerful and disturbing about the way the region seems locked in time. It is as if the bloodshed of the elves were only yesterday and not centuries ago. You can walk east and west across the docks, or head south into the shallow blood red waters of the harbour.

Room.Name: On a dock in a bloody harbour
Room.Description: You are on a collapsed and ruined dock made of rusted steel and decayed wood. To the south you can see one of the harbours of Myth Drannor, filled with a shallow blood red water that laps continuosly upon the ruined harbour. The salty smell of blood fills the air, and there is something powerful and disturbing about the way the region seems locked in time. It is as if the bloodshed of the elves were only yesterday and not centuries ago. You can walk east and west across the docks, or head south into the shallow blood red waters of the harbour.

Room.Name: On a dock in a bloody harbour
Room.Description: You are on a collapsed and ruined dock made of rusted steel and decayed wood. To the south you can see one of the harbours of Myth Drannor, filled with a shallow blood red water that laps continuosly upon the ruined harbour. The salty smell of blood fills the air, and there is something powerful and disturbing about the way the region seems locked in time. It is as if the bloodshed of the elves were only yesterday and not centuries ago. You can walk east and west across the docks, or head south into the shallow blood red waters of the harbour. There is a ruined old boat house to the north.

Room.Name: End of a dock in a bloody harbour
Room.Description: You are on a collapsed and ruined dock made of rusted steel and decayed wood. To the south you can see one of the harbours of Myth Drannor, filled with a shallow blood red water that laps continuosly upon the ruined harbour. The salty smell of blood fills the air, and there is something powerful and disturbing about the way the region seems locked in time. It is as if the bloodshed of the elves were only yesterday and not centuries ago. There is an old boat house to the north, or the docks head west towards the harbour.

Room.Name: In a destroyed boat house
Room.Description: This old wooden shack on the harbour is totally demolished. The wood and scraps left over from the city's destruction lie cluttered amidst the wet, bloody waters seeping in from the harbour. The only exit is back to the south to the ruined docks of the Drannor harbour.

Room.Name: Within a blood soaked boat house
Room.Description: This destroyed boat house is still covered in wet, warm blood. It is almost as if the annihilation of the elven people in the city had only just occurred in the last few hours, rather than centuries ago. The scent of warm salty blood still hangs in the air, and the waters outside lap up into the shack carrying more bloody red waters. The only exit is back to the south onto the ruined docks of the harbour.

Room.Name: In the northern ruins of the city
Room.Description: The ruins here seem to have been cleared somewhat and it is possible to just make your way through the rubble and into the northern part of the ruins. All around you the air seems unnaturally still an atmosphere of contained evil hangs all around you.

Room.Name: In the northern ruins of the city
Room.Description: You are standing in the rubbled remains of the ancient elven city. Very little has been left to observe and it's hard to see the old grandeur that once was. You can just make your way a little more north through the cleared rubble or head south to the main ruins.

Room.Name: In the northern ruins of the city
Room.Description: You are standing at the most northern part of the ruins that seems accessable. From here the rubble and ruin is impassable in all but the south, and even there it is only passable because someone has recently cleared a narrow path.

Room.Name: Wading through the bloody waters of the harbour
Room.Description: You are standing knee deep in the red tinted waters of the ancient harbour. Your steps are made harder by the sucking and clinging mud beneath the murky water, and the air is warm with the smell of blood. There are no fish to be seen and there is a total lack of animal prescence where normally water would attract much attention. Something very disturbing has happened here, and the power of it still lingers in the region. The harbour heads south and west, or you can go north onto the ruined docks.

Room.Name: Wading through the bloody waters of the harbour
Room.Description: You are standing knee deep in the red tinted waters of the ancient harbour. Your steps are made harder by the sucking and clinging mud beneath the murky water, and the air is warm with the smell of blood. There are no fish to be seen and there is a total lack of animal prescence where normally water would attract much attention. Something very disturbing has happened here, and the power of it still lingers in the region. The harbour waters go north, east and south. You can make out the docks off to the north.

Room.Name: Wading through the bloody waters of the harbour
Room.Description: You are standing knee deep in the red tinted waters of the ancient harbour. Your steps are made harder by the sucking and clinging mud beneath the murky water, and the air is warm with the smell of blood. There are no fish to be seen and there is a total lack of animal prescence where normally water would attract much attention. Something very disturbing has happened here, and the power of it still lingers in the region. The harbour waters head off in all directions around you. In the distance to the north you can make out some docks.

Room.Name: Wading through the bloody waters of the harbour
Room.Description: You are standing knee deep in the red tinted waters of the ancient harbour. Your steps are made harder by the sucking and clinging mud beneath the murky water, and the air is warm with the smell of blood. There are no fish to be seen and there is a total lack of animal prescence where normally water would attract much attention. Something very disturbing has happened here, and the power of it still lingers in the region. The harbour waters head off to the north, south and west. You can just make out the docks in the distance to the north.

Room.Name: Wading through the bloody waters of the harbour
Room.Description: You are standing knee deep in the red tinted waters of the ancient harbour. Your steps are made harder by the sucking and clinging mud beneath the murky water, and the air is warm with the smell of blood. There are no fish to be seen and there is a total lack of animal prescence where normally water would attract much attention. Something very disturbing has happened here, and the power of it still lingers in the region. The harbour waters head off to the north and east.

Room.Name: Before a bloody river outlet in the harbour
Room.Description: You are standing knee deep in the red tinted waters of the ancient harbour. Your steps are made harder by the sucking and clinging mud beneath the murky water, and the air is warm with the smell of blood. There are no fish to be seen and there is a total lack of animal prescence where normally water would attract much attention. Something very disturbing has happened here, and the power of it still lingers in the region. The harbour waters head off to the north, east and west. To the south the harbour narrows into a small channel of blood filled water.

Room.Name: Wading through the bloody waters of the harbour
Room.Description: You are standing knee deep in the red tinted waters of the ancient harbour. Your steps are made harder by the sucking and clinging mud beneath the murky water, and the air is warm with the smell of blood. There are no fish to be seen and there is a total lack of animal prescence where normally water would attract much attention. Something very disturbing has happened here, and the power of it still lingers in the region. The harbour waters head off to the north and west.

Room.Name: Wading through the bloody river outlet
Room.Description: You stand knee deep in the murky blood red waters of a small river flowing out of the harbour to the north. There is no sign of the normal animal activity you expect from a river in fertile forest land, and something dark and disturbing is in the air. The river continues to flow south, or you can head north into the shallow harbour waters of one of Drannor's ancient ports.

Room.Name: Wading through the bloody river outlet
Room.Description: You stand knee deep in the murky blood red waters of a small river flowing out of the harbour to the north. There is no sign of the normal animal activity you expect from a river in fertile forest land, and something dark and disturbing is in the air. The river continues to flow east or you can wade back north through it.

Room.Name: Wading through the bloody river outlet
Room.Description: You stand knee deep in the murky blood red waters of a small river flowing out of the harbour to the north. There is no sign of the normal animal activity you expect from a river in fertile forest land, and something dark and disturbing is in the air. The river continues to flow east or you can wade back west through it.

Room.Name: Wading through the bloody river outlet
Room.Description: You stand knee deep in the murky blood red waters of a small river flowing out of the harbour to the west and north. There is no sign of the normal animal activity you expect from a river in fertile forest land, and something dark and disturbing is in the air. The river continues to flow east or you can wade back west through it.

Room.Name: A bend in the bloody river outlet
Room.Description: You stand knee deep in the murky blood red waters of a small river flowing out of the harbours to the west and north. There is no sign of the normal animal activity you expect from a river in fertile forest land, and something dark and disturbing is in the air. The river continues to flow south or you can wade back west through it.

Room.Name: In a bone and blood filled river outlet
Room.Description: The blood red river is mixed with floating bones of elven origin. All around you bones of all sizes, from babies to adults, bob up and down in the murky river. None show signs of corrosiion or decay as you would expect after centuries in the water, and some even appear to almost have flesh still hanging off them. It is as if the region were preserved as it was on the day that the massacres occured. The river heads east where you can make out a large embankment of bones sitting high upon the river, or back north.

Room.Name: At the edge of a bone embankment
Room.Description: You have reached the edge of a huge, isle-like embankment made of bones from long dead elves. The bloody waters of the river flow around and through the gaps in the bone isle, and it is almost as if the massacre were yesterday rather than centuries ago. Something further off in the bone structure stirs, sending a tremor through them. The river heads back west, or you can go east onto the bone isle.

Room.Name: On an isle of elven bones
Room.Description: You stand on an isle consisting almost purely of bones from long dead elves. There must be thousands of bodies piled up here, all left to rot and decay in the bloody waters. Yet somehow they seem recent, like they were slain only recently rather than centuries ago. Something very dark and disturbing sends a chill through you as you gaze over the piles of bones. To the north and east you can see the ruins of many ships that were destroyed as the elves tried to flee the massacre. West of here the isle heads out to the river.

Room.Name: On an isle of elven bones
Room.Description: You stand on an isle consisting almost purely of bones from long dead elves. There must be thousands of bodies piled up here, all left to rot and decay in the bloody waters. Yet somehow they seem recent, like they were slain only recently rather than centuries ago. For a moment it seems the isle shifts beneath you as if the bones were still alive...a chill through you as you gaze over the isle of bones. To the north you can see the ruins of many ships that were destroyed as the elves tried to flee the massacre.

Room.Name: On an isle of elven bones
Room.Description: You stand on an isle consisting almost purely of bones from long dead elves. There must be thousands of bodies piled up here, all left to rot and decay in the bloody waters. Yet somehow they seem recent, like they were slain only recently rather than centuries ago. For a moment it seems the isle shifts beneath you as if the bones were still alive...a chill through you as you gaze over the isle of bones. To the north and west you can see the ruins of many ships that were destroyed as the elves tried to flee the massacre. East of here there is a huge mountain of bones blocking the river flow.

Room.Name: At the entrance to a restored building
Room.Description: Here amongst the ruins of Myth Drannor a single building seems to have been restored from the destruction. The stone building shows the signs of massive damage that everything else shows, but it has been restored to an almost decent level by someone or something. As you walk by the building your feet slip in some thick, sticky fluid that gives off a terribly stench. A doorway leads north into the building or you can go east, south or west around the rubble of the city.

Room.Name: On an isle of elven bones
Room.Description: You stand on an isle consisting almost purely of bones from long dead elves. There must be thousands of bodies piled up here, all left to rot and decay in the bloody waters. Yet somehow they seem recent, like they were slain only recently rather than centuries ago. For a moment it seems the isle shifts beneath you as if the bones were still alive...a chill through you as you gaze over the isle of bones. To the north you can see the ruins of many ships that were destroyed as the elves tried to flee the massacre.

Room.Name: On an isle of elven bones
Room.Description: You stand on an isle consisting almost purely of bones from long dead elves. There must be thousands of bodies piled up here, all left to rot and decay in the bloody waters. Yet somehow they seem recent, like they were slain only recently rather than centuries ago. For a moment it seems the isle shifts beneath you as if the bones were still alive...a chill through you as you gaze over the isle of bones. To the west and north you can see the ruins of many ships that were destroyed as the elves tried to flee the massacre.

Room.Name: Before a dam built from elven bones
Room.Description: You are at the edge of the isle of bones where a huge pile has been erected to totally seal of the river. There must be thousands of dead elves left here to dam up the river, preventing the waters from flowing out of the harbours of Myth Drannor, and keeping it forever in a state of bloody waters. The bones around you seem to shift slightly, and it's like being in an earthquake of bones. The isle heads back to the west, and there is no way through the solid blockade to the east.

Room.Name: Standing at the edge of a huge graveyard of ships
Room.Description: Here at the northern edge of the bone isle you can see the extent of the massacre that must have occured centuries ago. Scores of large ships and boats have been totally demolished and left to rot in the bloody, bone filled waters. Burnt and blasted hulls litter the entire region, and skeletons of elves hang lifelessly from the helms and bridges of them. There is no doubt that the forces that blocked and slayed the elves as they tried to flee were powerful beyond anything seen in recent times. The smashed boat graveyard is too hazardous to explore, and you can only head back south onto the isle of elf bones.

Room.Name: In the ruins of the city walls
Room.Description: The walls here is hollowed out for defence, but the dried skeletons that lie scattered across the floor show that it did little good. The air is dusty and dry, stale with ages of being kept locked up. There is slight break in the west wall here, or you can head south along the inside of the wall.

Room.Name: In the ruins of the city walls
Room.Description: The crumbling walls here are just as bad as outside, and the air is stale and stinks of death. You can head south or north.

Room.Name: Above a hole in the city walls
Room.Description: Here in the crumbling walls of the city you can see a small hole that has been excavated in the ground. The work is poor and hasty, and there is no signs of life down below. The wall passage heads back north.

Room.Name: In a small excavated hole beneath the walls
Room.Description: You are in a small hole that seems to have been dug out in a hurry. The ground is littered with long dead elven skeletons, and there is nothing of interest that hasn't already long been decayed. A hole leads back up, or you can go north to what appears to be a door.

Room.Name: Outside a door in the crumbling walls
Room.Description: You are standing in the dark tunnel beneath the city walls. For some reason the tunnel here hasn't collapsed like most of the ruins, and there is a large oak door in the east wall which is in extremely good condition.

ExtraDescription.Description: The door seems to feel warm, almost like it were alive. There is, however, nothing that really seems special about it.

Room.Name: Inside a small room beneath the crumbling walls
Room.Description: You are in a tiny, bare room that is in almost perfect condition. Unlike the rest of the ruins this room has no signs of decay or ruin, and it is almost as if it had been built yesterday. There is, however, nothing of interest in it but the large oak door in the west wall.

ExtraDescription.Description: The door seems to feel warm, almost like it were alive. There is, however, nothing that really seems special about it.

Room.Name: On an isle of elven bones
Room.Description: You stand on an isle consisting almost purely of bones from long dead elves. There must be thousands of bodies piled up here, all left to rot and decay in the bloody waters. Yet somehow they seem recent, like they were slain only recently rather than centuries ago. For a moment it seems the isle shifts beneath you as if the bones were still alive...a chill through you as you gaze over the isle of bones. To the east and north you can see the ruins of many ships that were destroyed as the elves tried to flee the massacre.

Room.Name: On a wet, marshland path in the ruins
Room.Description: You are on a path through the marshlands that have overgrown the ancient ruins. There is a faint smell of salty sea water coming from the east, and to the west the path heads back to a T-junction in the swamps.

Room.Name: Wading through the bloody waters of the harbour
Room.Description: You are standing knee deep in the red tinted waters of the ancient harbour. Your steps are made harder by the sucking and clinging mud beneath the murky water, and the air is warm with the smell of blood. There are no fish to be seen and there is a total lack of animal prescence where normally water would attract much attention. Something very disturbing has happened here, and the power of it still lingers in the region. The harbour heads east and south, or you can go north onto the ruined docks.

Room.Name: Wading through the bloody waters of the harbour
Room.Description: You are standing knee deep in the red tinted waters of the ancient harbour. Your steps are made harder by the sucking and clinging mud beneath the murky water, and the air is warm with the smell of blood. There are no fish to be seen and there is a total lack of animal prescence where normally water would attract much attention. Something very disturbing has happened here, and the power of it still lingers in the region. The harbour heads east, south and west, or you can go north onto the ruined docks.

Room.Name: In a burnt out harbour-master's room
Room.Description: You are in the ruined remains of what was once the harbour master's room for this port of Myth Drannor's boats. There is nothing here now but the smell of blood and a feeling of disturbed peace. It is as if time has stopped here, capturing the feel and blood of the ancient fall of the city, rather than being just another dried out hole that you would expect. You can head south onto the docks.

Room.Name: At the edge of the swampland ruins
Room.Description: You are at the eastern edge of the ruins amongst the overgrown swamps. To the east you can make out what looks like the ruins of one of the city's ancient harbours. Unlike the rest of the swampy ruins the harbour to the east seems to be relatively free of swamp and forest growth, and there is the strong smell of salt water, or blood, in the air...

NPC.name: spirit
NPC.description: The ghost of a lost elf, killed in violence without last rites and with nobody to guide the lost soul to where it belongs.
NPC.longDescription: A ghastly insubstantial elf wanders amongst the ruins.
NPC.flags: NPC Aggressive StayArea Undead Warrior Fade
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Infrared DetectIllusion PassDoor DarkVision

NPC.name: beast cacodaemon daemon
NPC.description: This unearthly creature is an example of what has replaced the once peaceful elves of the ancient city. It has eyes of darkness and seems at home amidst the ruins.
NPC.longDescription: A huge beast with a twisted horn snarls and charges you!
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Sanctuary Infrared DetectIllusion

NPC.name: knight
NPC.description: This man stands watch over the ruins, making sure the evil within it stays there.
NPC.longDescription: A tall knight stands here watching for signs of evil.

NPC.name: drow marauder
NPC.description: This dark elven scout seems angry and disturbed. His rightful position, at least in his mind, is inside the lower level of the enclaves where the true power is held.
NPC.longDescription: An ebon skinned elf is here scowling at the shadows.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Infrared Curse Sneak

NPC.name: plant trap
NPC.description: The plants that are growing here in the ruins are not quite as harmless as the normal ones in the forests around the rest of Orthos. This one has evil looking branches covered in sharp thorns, and it actually moves and lashes at you!
NPC.longDescription: A wickedly spiked plant sways gently in the breeze.

NPC.name: golem
NPC.description: This huge automaton stands eternally vigilant over the tower before it. It's body is shaped like a giant but it has nothing in it's mind but the commands of it's long dead masters.
NPC.longDescription: A golem carved from red stone stands here.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Sanctuary Infrared DetectIllusion

NPC.name: green dragon
NPC.description: This is one of the largest dragons you have ever seen. Larger even than the massive reds that are found in the dragon towers. It's body is covered in thick green scales as hard as steel and a cloud of corrosive, poison gas clings to it like an outer shell.
NPC.longDescription: A massive green dragon stands amidst a cloud of toxic gas.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Sanctuary Infrared Flying

NPC.name: lizard man lizardman
NPC.description: A creature with green, dirty-looking skin gazes at you and grins evilly at your presence.
NPC.longDescription: A giant lizardman is here scavangeing amongst the ruins.

NPC.name: shadow demon
NPC.description: A blood-red eyes looks at you with immense hatred, sharp claws flashing in the moonlight. Creation of Forgotten Gods shadow demon guards lost secrets of Myth Drannor.
NPC.longDescription: A dark shadow is moving in silence between the rubble.
NPC.flags: NPC Aggressive StayArea Warrior Fade AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Infrared Haste DetectIllusion

NPC.name: blue golem
NPC.description: This huge automaton stands eternally vigilant over the tower before it. It's body is shaped like a giant but it has nothing in it's mind but the commands of it's long dead masters.
NPC.longDescription: A golem carved from blue stone stands here.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Sanctuary Infrared DetectIllusion

NPC.name: green golem
NPC.description: This huge automaton stands eternally vigilant over the tower before it. It's body is shaped like a giant but it has nothing in it's mind but the commands of it's long dead masters.
NPC.longDescription: A golem carved from green stone stands here.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Sanctuary Infrared DetectIllusion

NPC.name: black golem
NPC.description: This huge automaton stands eternally vigilant over the tower before it. It's body is shaped like a giant but it has nothing in it's mind but the commands of it's long dead masters.
NPC.longDescription: A golem carved from black stone stands here.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Sanctuary Infrared DetectIllusion

NPC.name: draconian three tyranthraxus
NPC.description: Creature with three heads hisses at you in primal fury. Lord of Astral planes Tyranthraxus now rides Orthos.
NPC.longDescription: A massive three headed draconian hisses in fury!
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Warrior AreaAttack AssistVnum

NPC.name: dark prescence spectre king
NPC.description: When the last of the elves had fallen in Myth Drannor the ancient evil that had been buried beneath it arose to return to the world. But there was still another unforseen step required and the darkness, while searching for that last piece, required servants to guard It. The last elf king of Myth Drannor was one of these, and now his spectre guards the way to the greatest evil.
NPC.longDescription: A cold and dark prescence forms out of the freezing air.
NPC.shortDescription: the spectre of the elven First king
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Cleric Warrior AreaAttack Fade AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Sanctuary Haste DetectIllusion

NPC.name: fallen angel
NPC.description: As part of the evil one's final return to the world he has called upon all of his most powerful servants. When failing to find the last piece required to break the imprisonment this Fallen angel was posted as a guard to prevent anyone from entering while It was still vulnerable and imprisoned.
NPC.longDescription: A tall man with pale eyes and shredded bloody wings is here.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Warrior AreaAttack Fade AssistVnum

NPC.name: lord bane
NPC.description: You see nothing special about it. In fact it is so pure pitch-black around this being you can see nothing at all!
NPC.longDescription: A towering prescence of indescribable power dominates the room!
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Warrior AreaAttack AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Sanctuary Haste DetectIllusion

NPC.name: rock imp
NPC.longDescription: A fiendish looking imp with stone-grey wings watches the ruins.

NPC.name: ogre
NPC.description: This ogre has the look of someone who's prepetually hungry. It seems a little dull witted even for an ogre, and you notice it's eyes a red from lack of sleep. It seems even the creatures who prey on others are not safe in these ruins.
NPC.longDescription: A huge ogre is here gnawing on the bone of some unfortunate creature.

NPC.name: stone giant
NPC.description: This giant is right at home here within the broken stones of Myth Drannor. It's skin matches the colour of the rocks and debri, making it very hard to see as it hunts for victims to satisfy it's hunger and bloodlust.
NPC.longDescription: A grey skinned giant is grinning as he walks amongsth the ruins.

NPC.name: paladin lord knight
NPC.description: This lord paladin has entered to find the greatest evil that resides within the ruins. His quest so far has been to no avail for he cannot breach the inner regions of the black tower and is unable to fight his way past what he suspects may hold the key.
NPC.longDescription: A tall man rests upon a rock as he surveys the ruins.
NPC.shortDescription: a paladin knight of Myth Drannor
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Cleric Warrior AreaAttack
NPC.affectedBy: DetectEvil DetectInvis DetectMagic Sanctuary Infrared ProtectionEvil DetectIllusion

NPC.name: hydra neo neohydra
NPC.description: This thing is HUGE. It's body is the size of a house and the three heads that swing around scanning for victims are like dragon heads, only there are three of them at once.
NPC.longDescription: A huge triple headed hydra swings it's heads about in seach of prey!

NPC.name: skeletal elf skeleton
NPC.description: These bones are all that are left of one of the thousands of elves that tried to flee the destruction of Myth Drannor so many centuries ago. Now cursed to live forever in the state of undying hell in the bone graveyards, it seeks a new life to live and will kill for it...
NPC.longDescription: A heap of staggering bones is trying to seek out a new life.

NPC.name: girl lady elf
NPC.description: This girl is totally out of place here. She has a look of ancient sadness about her that is totally uncharacteristic for an elf. She seems to want you to do something for her...
NPC.longDescription: A stunning elven girl with crystal clear blue eyes stands here.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Sanctuary Infrared Sneak Haste

NPC.name: mud dweller
NPC.description: This piece of disgusting matter seems to be made of the very dirt and slime that you walk upon. It has very little sense other than it's hunger, but it is still a dangerous creature to be around.
NPC.longDescription: A slimy lump of mud oozes out of the ground and slides towards you.

NPC.name: hissing frog
NPC.description: This frog seems to have suffered from some kind of unnatural growth and dark mutation. It's body is about the size of a horse, and as it hisses a spray of burning acid lands on the ground sizzling.
NPC.longDescription: A giant frog hisses and flicks it's pointed tongue out at you.

NPC.name: elf knight
NPC.description: The knights of ancient Myth Drannor still respond to the call of their horn and will return to serve in times of great need, as proven by this knights return from the dead.
NPC.longDescription: A shimmering elven knight with a ghostly form is here.
NPC.shortDescription: an elven knight of ages past

NPC.name: bone demon
NPC.description: This being seems to be from the pieces of elven bones that lie scattered all around the region. It's size is tremendous, easily dwarfing even a giant or small dragon. There is something extremely evil about it's prescence here at the blocked river, as if it were the symbol of the darkness that trapped the doomed elves here in their ships.
NPC.longDescription: A huge creature composed of hundreds of elven bones stands here.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Undead Warrior AreaAttack

NPC.name: mist wraith
NPC.description: There is little to see of this undead wraith, other than that it appears to be some kind of elven spirit seeking something long lost.
NPC.longDescription: A misty insubstantial wraith is rising out of the ground here.

Item.Name: spear
Item.LongDescription: A long rusted spear is on the ground.

Item.Name: scimitar
Item.LongDescription: A large but rusted scimitar is on the ground.

Item.Name: large iron shield
Item.LongDescription: A piece of iron battered into the shape of a shield is here.

Item.Name: chainmail
Item.LongDescription: Some chainmail armor is on the ground.

Item.Name: longsword
Item.LongDescription: A smooth-bladed longsword is on the ground.

Item.Name: armor field plate
Item.LongDescription: A set of light field armor is on the ground.

Item.Name: leather gauntlets
Item.LongDescription: A pair of hard leather gauntlets are on the ground.

Item.Name: red quartz ring
Item.ShortDescription: a ring of red stained quartz
Item.LongDescription: A ring made of some red stone is on the ground.

Item.Name: green quartz ring
Item.ShortDescription: a ring of green stained quartz
Item.LongDescription: A ring made of some green stone is on the ground.

Item.Name: blue quartz ring
Item.ShortDescription: a ring of blue stained quartz
Item.LongDescription: A ring made of some green stone is on the ground.

Item.Name: black quartz ring
Item.ShortDescription: a ring of black stained quartz
Item.LongDescription: A ring made of some black stone is on the ground.

Item.Name: bloody shredded angel wings
Item.ShortDescription: the shredded wings of a fallen angel
Item.LongDescription: The shredded and bloody remains of some creature's wings are here.
Item.ExtraFlags: Dark Evil Magic NoDrop NoRemove VisDeath

Item.Name: horns bane
Item.LongDescription: A pair of black horns rimmed with blue-green flames is here.
Item.ExtraFlags: Glow Hum Dark Evil Invisibility Magic NoDrop AntiGood AntiNeutral

ExtraDescription.Description: These remains of the ancient god Bane still have the last flames of the magic used to imprison him. The blue-green fire burns softly around the horns and gives them an unreal appearance, as if they are ready to vanish into thin air.

Item.Name: scroll binding power
Item.LongDescription: A scroll with intricate writing has been left here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This is one of the last great artifacts of the ancient city of Myth Drannor. The elven archmages had prepared it in order to help create a weapon powerful enough to fight the evil that was coming, but they were defeated first and the scroll was taken by Bane in order to help him break the bonds that held him beneath the ancient city.

Item.Name: red sword planes
Item.LongDescription: A straight red sword lies on the ground.

Item.Name: torque restoration silver circle
Item.LongDescription: A shiny circle of silver is on the ground.

Item.Name: crown frozen blood red
Item.LongDescription: A crown of frozen red blood is here.

Item.Name: rod lordly might
Item.LongDescription: A beautifully carved rod of steel is on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: It appears to be a dull and useless ceremonial staff. There are some strange markings on the rod...

There are several scratches and words on the rod, one looks like a mace, another like a sword, and yet another which is some kind of strange star-like symbol. The words 'rulers are just figureheads' are etched into the base of it.
The words 'rulership is for the divine' are written alongside the star etched into the rod's surface.
The words 'rule with an iron fist' are written alongside the mace etched into the rod's surfaec.
There are some words scrawled next to the symbol of the sword on the rod's surface, reading 'the strong rule the weak'.

Item.Name: steel mace
Item.LongDescription: A shiny mace of steel is here.

Item.Name: circle bracelet frozen elf blood
Item.ShortDescription: a bracelet of frozen elf blood
Item.LongDescription: A horrible circle of congealed, frozen blood is on the ground.
Item.ExtraFlags: Dark Evil Invisibility Magic NoDrop Bless AntiGood AntiNeutral NoRemove VisDeath

ExtraDescription.Description: The blood is congealed and disgustingly frozen, yet there almost seems to be some kind of life within it, screaming for release. It as is if the elf whose blood was taken is still contained, screaming for release.,

Item.Name: skull ancient god
Item.ShortDescription: the skull of an ancient god
Item.LongDescription: A huge black skull with a demonic leer is watching you!
Item.ExtraFlags: Glow Hum Dark Evil Magic NoDrop Bless AntiGood AntiEvil NoRemove VisDeath

Item.Name: suffering
Item.LongDescription: An object of pure suffering is on the ground.

Item.Name: wrath
Item.LongDescription: An object of unholy wrath is lying on the floor.

Item.Name: bracelet woven elf hair
Item.ShortDescription: a bracelet woven from the hair an elf
Item.LongDescription: A beautiful bracelet made fomr woven elf hair is on the ground.

Item.Name: stone club
Item.LongDescription: A large club made from a long piece of stone is here.

Item.Name: poncho skin stone
Item.ShortDescription: a poncho from the skin of a stone giant
Item.LongDescription: A piece of very tough skin the colour of stone is lying here.

Item.Name: rear green dragon claws
Item.ShortDescription: the rear claws of a green dragon
Item.LongDescription: A large pair of green dragon claws lie on the ground.

Item.Name: stone green orb dragonorb
Item.LongDescription: A large green stone lies on the ground.

Item.Name: shining mace
Item.LongDescription: A ball of brilliant green light rests here.
Item.ExtraFlags: Glow Hum Bless AntiEvil AntiNeutral NoRemove Frost Sharp TwoHands Poison Unholy

ExtraDescription.Description: This weapon appears to be made of pure energy. The green light that constitutes the mace's head radiates an aura of holy righteousness that seems to sooth your worries. It doesn't appear as powerful as many weapons you have heard of, yet there is something about it that suggests it is for a special purpose.

Item.Name: scroll protection
Item.LongDescription: A white scroll is resting here waiting to be used.

Item.Name: helm brilliance
Item.LongDescription: A beautiful helm studded with glowing gems is here.

Item.Name: flawless cape white knights
Item.LongDescription: A flowing white cape of flawless make is on the ground.

Item.Name: black key
Item.LongDescription: A large sheer black key is here.

Item.Name: hydra neohydra head
Item.LongDescription: A huge head of a decapitated hydra is here.

Item.Name: cutter hydraslayer slayer
Item.LongDescription: A sharp slicing instrument is lying on the ground.

Item.Name: horn valere
Item.LongDescription: A large horn of ancient elven make is on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: The horn is made of some uniquely tempered steel and seems to be alive with some holy power. You can hear the faint sounds of royal battle calls echoing in the depths of the horn's recess.

Item.Name: rusty sword
Item.LongDescription: A rusty sword is lying half buried in the muck.

ExtraDescription.Description: The weapon is totally rusted through and almost attached to the ground now after all the time it has lain here in the swampy muck.

Item.Name: axe
Item.LongDescription: A large decayed axe is sticking out of the muddy ground here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This weapon of ages past is so broken it's even more useless than your bare hands would be in a fight.

Item.Name: rusted rusty armor
Item.LongDescription: A pile of rusted armor lies buried in the dirt.

ExtraDescription.Description: This armor is so far gone into decay and ruin that it actually hinders your ability to fight.

Item.Name: skeleton
Item.LongDescription: A half buried skeleton is poking up from the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: It looks like one of the ancient elves that fell in the city's death, left here to rot away like garbage.

Item.Name: corpse
Item.LongDescription: A blood soaked corpse of a dark elf is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This corpse looks very recent, and shows signs of violent beastial bites and claw wounding. The creatures that did this must have very little care for the lives of others.

Item.Name: rock boulder
Item.LongDescription: A large smooth boulder rests on the ground here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This rock seems to be placed here rather purposefully compared to the rest of the chaotic ruins lying all around...perhaps there is something under it...
